title: Inference procedure for cars in student parking

content.question: Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following is the appropriate test for the investigation?

choices.label: A two-sample <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between means
A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a mean difference

content.answer: A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a mean difference

topic.text: 7.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
